title: Elon Musk Returns to Twitter, Posting Photo With Pope; Tesla chief executive breaks his longest silence for years on the social-media platform he is seeking to buy
text:
"Honored to meet @Pontifex yesterday," Mr. Musk tweeted. He posted a photo from the meeting showing himself and four of his children with Pope Francis. The Vatican didn't immediately respond to requests for comment.

Mr. Musk's Twitter silence came after a period of particularly active tweeting about his bid to buy the messaging platform, including many posts about the proposed deal in which he talked about his criticism of the company and its policies.

Mr. Musk reached a deal to acquire Twitter Inc. on April 25, but later said the deal was on hold over his concerns that Twitter's estimate of spam and fake accounts might be flawed.

During his absence from Twitter, Mr. Musk's account surpassed 100 million followers.

Pope Francis is also among the platform's most prominent users, tweeting via nine accounts in English, German, Spanish, Portuguese, Polish, Italian, French, Arabic and Latin. His English @pontifex account has 18.9 million followers.

The pope has met with other tech leaders, including Apple Inc. Chief Executive Tim Cook and Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg. At their meeting in 2016, the Vatican said, Pope Francis and Mr. Zuckerberg discussed "how communications technology can be used to alleviate poverty, encourage a culture of encounter and help deliver a message of hope, especially to the most disadvantaged people."

Mr. Zuckerberg, accompanied by his wife, Priscilla Chan, gave the pope a model replica of Aquila, a solar-powered drone designed to beam internet connectivity to remote areas. Development of Aquila was halted in 2018.

Mr. Musk gave no indication early Saturday of why he hadn't tweeted for 11 days, but gave a possible hint of why he had returned, tweeting: "Feeling…perhaps…a little bored?"
